Instrument.name: Photopolarimeter Radiometer
Instrument.description: The Photopolarimeter-Radiometer (PPR) experiment was designed to measure the linear polarization and intensity of reflected sunlight and the intensity of thermally emitted infrared radiation from Jupiter and the Galilean satellites. The primary science objectives of the PPR were to: (1) determine the vertical and horizontal distribution of cloud and haze particles in the Jovian atmosphere, including their size, shape, and refractive index; (2) determine the energy budget of Jupiter and the variation in amount and spatial distribution of reflected solar radiation and emitted thermal radiation for Jupiter and its satellites, including the thermal structure of the Jovian atmosphere and the vertical distribution of absorbed solar radiation therein; and, (3) measure and map the photometric, polarimetric, and radiometric properties of the Galilean satellites and other targets of opportunity.
